intro: Rubus transitus, commonly known as the wandering raspberry, is a shrub native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits. The plant typically grows in woodlands, hedgerows, and disturbed soils, thriving in partial shade to full sun. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, while its flowers are pinkish-white with five petals. The fruit, which ripens in late summer, is edible and has a tart, raspberry-like flavor.
